sentences.sContent: Emergency services are facing additional problems this winter.
sentences.sCn: 今年冬天，应急服务机构面临更多难题。

sentences.sContent: The President faces the difficult task of putting the economy back on its feet.
sentences.sCn: 总统面临着恢复经济的艰巨任务。

sentences.sContent: McManus is facing the biggest challenge of his career.
sentences.sCn: 麦克马纳斯正面临着事业上的最大挑战。

sentences.sContent: As the project comes to an end, many workers now face an uncertain future.
sentences.sCn: 随着工程结束，许多工人现在前途未卜。

sentences.sContent: He must face the prospect of financial ruin.
sentences.sCn: 他必须面对破产的可能性。

sentences.sContent: the difficulties faced by the police
If he is found guilty, he faces up to 12 years in jail.
sentences.sCn: 要是他被判有罪，就将面临最多12年的刑期。

勇敢地面对困难；接受应得的惩罚

面值，票面价值；表面价值

trans.tranCn: 面向， 正对； 面对， 面临
trans.tranOther: if you face or are faced with a difficult situation, or if a difficult situation faces you, it is going to affect you and you must deal with it
